alert.note: Alert for Curry (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 15 at 10:56PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central New Mexico, including the following counties, Curry and Roosevelt and the communities of Clovis, Portales and Cannon Air Force Base. * WHEN...Until 200 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas such as ditches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1056 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding, especially at street intersections and nearby ditches. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clovis, Portales, Texico, Cannon Air Force Base, Oasis State Park, Ranchvale, Saint Vrain, Floyd, Portair and Pleasant Hill. - This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 372 and 397. - http://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
